change.title: In ORS and FSS Online, COs/CSs will now be able to download all documents on the Associated Docs tabs with a Download All button.

motivation.description: eOffer and eMod are receiving a revision to their user interface (UI) and will now have an up-to-date look and feel.

effect.description: Be aware that screens within eOffer/eMod have been updated but the functionality remains the same.

change.title: In ORS and FSS Online, COs/CSs will now be able to download all documents on the Associated Docs tabs with a Download All button.

motivation.description: Previously in ORS and FSS Online, COs/CSs had to view or download associated documents individually.

effect.description: COs/CSs should be aware that they can now download all documents in Associated Documents sections of ORS and FSS Online with one button. This will not impact the contract package or award package.

change.title: In FSS Online, corrections have been made to cycle time reports for accuracy and clarity.

motivation.description: Various reports in FSS Online were displaying incorrect information or erroneous error messages.

effect.description: Be aware the reporting accuracy and messages have been improved.

change.title: In FSS Online, COs/CSs can now specify DUNC or DUNS when loading a new contract or correcting an existing contract.

motivation.description: COs/CSs did not have an easy way to designate a contractor’s primary contact information between their DUNC (DUN-Contractor) or DUNS (DUN-Supplier) contact information. Order Management Services (OMS) would automatically send information to a vendor’s DUNS (DUN-Supplier) contact information.

effect.description: COs/CSs should be aware that they may select a vendor’s primary contact information through the DUNS Indicator field on the Contract Load screen in FSS Online. The selected contact information will be used for fulfilling purchase orders in OMS.

change.title: ECMS has been updated to provide COs changing a DCN with only applicable vendor DCNs, and to notify eMod of DCN changes to ensure the systems stay in sync.

motivation.description: When a CO would change the DCN for a vendor uploaded document, they were presented with a list of all possible DCNs instead of only vendor DCNs. When a DCN was updated in ECMS, it was not automatically synced in eMod.

effect.description: Be aware that changing the DCN for vendor uploaded documents will be a more seamless experience.

change.title: In FSS Online, As part of the transition to uPIID contract number format, COs/CSs can now enter instrument type in several places, including contract load.

motivation.description: FSS Online must comply with FAR Part 4.605(e), which requires agencies to standardize the format of the Procurement Instrument Identifier (PIID) and report the PIID to the Federal Procurement Data System - Next Generation (FPDS-NG). These updates were made as part of the transition to uPIID format.

effect.description: To enter an instrument type, users should select “Yes” when asked if the solicitation number is in the uPIID format.

change.title: eOffer and eMod are phasing out the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA).

motivation.description: The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA) has come to an end and is no longer applicable to solicitations.

effect.description: Be aware that ARRA no longer applies to solicitations.

change.title: UX/UI Improvements to eOffer/eMod

motivation.description: The Office of Customer Experience conducted user experience testing with eOffer/eMod and identified opportunities to improve usability.

effect.description: COs/CSs should be aware that the user experience of eOffer/eMod has been improved.

change.title: Contract Files Will Indicate If a Document Is Part of the Award Package in ECMS

motivation.description: The list of documents within a Contract File did not indicate whether a document was a part of the Award Package.

effect.description:
COs/CSs should be aware of the new column within ECMS to indicate whether a document is a part of the Award Package. To enable the new column, users should:

  1. Access the submenu Document List
  2. Access the "columns" menu
  3. Select "Document" from the drop-down menu
  4. Select the appropriate column and use the arrow to add it to their Document Lists

change.title: FSS Online Option Date Reports for BPAs with Non-MAS Parent Contracts

motivation.description: Previously options awarded to BPAs with non-MAS parent contracts were complicated because of misaligned end dates. The rules were altered to allow greater visibility in and flexibility to ensure COs could manage and exercise options for these BPAs. In July 2017, COs were given the ability to enter Options date information for non-MAS contracts within FSS Online. This information about Option dates was not accessible through running reports.

effect.description: COs can now run reports in FSS Online to view beginning and end dates for BPAs and their non-MAS parent contracts. Note that the report will return all contracts that have active time within the report period, even if the begin date is prior to the report period.

image.caption: How to access the Option Date Report.
image.alternateText: How to access the Option Date Report.

change.title: Test Site for Training on FSS Online for Designated Trainers

motivation.description: Users have been requesting a more flexible representative environment in which to conduct training.

effect.description:
COs/CSs should be aware that the designated trainer within each group can provide access to the FSS Online demo environment. Seek out your designated trainer if you wish to explore the test environment.

COs/CSs should also note that although currently only the test site for FSS Online is live, other systems will be added in the future.

change.title: eLibrary Can Display Contact Information from the Contract Master File Instead of the Vendor Master File

motivation.description: Previously eLibrary displayed contract email and url’s based off what was found in a vendor’s DUNS. If a vendor has multiple contracts, the contact information was still drawn from the DUNS and not the Contract Master File. This lead to complications as the actual points of contact were different from the listed contacts.

effect.description: COs/CSs should be aware that eLibrary is now able to show different contract specific contact email addresses and URLs across different contracts from the same vendor.

image.caption: The eLibrary interface. Click the “Vendor” tab to display vendor information, including contact information.
image.alternateText: The eLibrary interface. Click the “Vendor” tab to display vendor information, including contact information.

image.caption: Click the “Correction” button to make edits to contract-specific information.
image.alternateText: Click the “Correction” button to make edits to contract-specific information.

image.caption: The eMail and URL fields above may be used to make contract-specific edits. The lower half of the screen shows DUNS-related contact information.
image.alternateText: The eMail and URL fields above may be used to make contract-specific edits. The lower half of the screen shows DUNS-related contact information.

change.title: Ensure that Downloaded Files Retain Their Original Filenames in FSS Online

motivation.description: Previous when downloading documents from a contract file in FSS Online, the file names were lost upon download. A previous fix worked for PDF documents but was inconsistent with Microsoft formats.

effect.description: Be aware that filenames will be preserved when downloading documents from FSS Online.

change.title: Allow the CO/CS to Attach Option Mod Documents Via FSS Online

motivation.description: Previously, COs/CSs were unable to attach option documents via FSS Online and process the award of the option modification.

effect.description: Be aware that COs/CSs can create an option mod for vendors to then add attachments in eMod. The CO/CS can also receive attachments outside of eMod from the vendor and attach them through FSS Online, and then submit the modification unilaterally.

change.title: Authorized Negotiators May Now Access Work in Progress and Contract History

motivation.description: When a new Authorized Negotiator was added to a contract, they were not able to access all previous modifications or any work-in-progress mods.

effect.description: Be aware that all current and future negotiators have the ability to access contract history and any work-in-progress modifications.

change.title: Updates to Formatted Products Tool (FPT) for Schedules 58I and 72 Only

motivation.description: A process was required to give vendors the capability to comment on standardized XSB data and note when they wanted to keep the original information.

effect.description: Be aware that vendors can now add comments if they do not agree with the standardized XSB data returned while processing an “Add Product,” “Add SIN,” or “Capture Formatted Pricing” modification. The CO can either agree or disagree with the vendor’s request.

change.title: Technical Proposal Required for Add SIN Mod Type

motivation.description: The addition of a new SIN may impact aspects of the technical proposal. The recently implemented on-screen technical proposal interface was initially deployed as part of the offer process only. This functionality is being expanded to apply to “Add SIN” modifications.

effect.description: Vendors are now required to enter a technical proposal via the on-screen entry as part of submitting an “Add SIN” modification. If you submitted a technical proposal as part of your offer, then the content you submitted will be prepopulated and presented for your review. If you did not submit a technical proposal as part of your offer, then you will need to address the required elements as part of completing the modification.

change.title: Industrial Funding Fee (IFF) POC Field

motivation.description: Previously, the Industrial Funding Fee Point of Contact (IFF POC) was only required for offerors completing a subcontracting plan.

effect.description:
Be aware that the Industrial Funding Fee POC is now a mandatory POC for all offers, and that multiple entries are permitted. Existing vendors can manage this Point of Contact through a new modification time being introduced.

For existing contract holders, this POC will be pre-populated with the information of the person listed as the 72A POC;. You will need to validate and/or update this information if you wish to designate a different individual. In addition, these new POCs may need their own digital certificates in order to access eOffer/eMod.

change.title: New Formatted Product Tool Process

motivation.description: The Formatted Product Tool introduces a new, more comprehensive interface for offerors and existing contract holders to input data about their products. The process will allow for additional review and validation, resulting in cleaner and more accurate product data across the schedules program.

effect.description:
The Formatted Product Tool will be rolled out to select schedules over the course of the next few months. If you are have a contract under a participating schedule, you will receive a mass mod for that contract. Upon accepting the mass mod, you will have access to the new process, and will be able to enter detailed pricing information for each of your products and accessories, including discounts, warranties, delivery options, and more. The tool also streamlines multiple sections of eOffer/eMod.

You will find both interactive training and step-by-step instructions on the Formatted Product Tool in the eOffer/eMod User Guide.

For the most up to date information about the Formatted Product Tool rollout, please visit the MAS Interact group located at: https://interact.gsa.gov/groups/multiple-award-schedules.

change.title: Capture the Vendor Response(s) for Each Clause in Offers and in Mods

motivation.description: Previously, the Solicitation Clauses section of eOffer/eMod only consisted of one screen that captured a limited amount of data. That section has been updated with new functionality for more detailed responding, which is tailored to your schedule, so that your offer will be managed more intelligently.

effect.description: Visit the new Responding to Solicitation Clauses section of the updated eOffer/eMod user guides.

change.title: Mass Mod for PSS

motivation.description: The Professional Service Schedule was added on October 1, 2015. This schedule was being populated with C SINs rather than the correct non-C equivalent.

effect.description: Be aware that you will no longer see the C SINs, but only their non-C equivalent.

change.title: Streamlined Offers and Configurable Year Thresholds

motivation.description: The number of MAS contractors coming up on their 20-year maximum contract lifespans will increase rapidly over the next few years. Policy and Administration wanted to streamline the offer process for contractors who have had a successful contract period, by exempting repeat “legacy” contractors from some of the requirements associated with submitting a new MAS offer.

effect.description: Qualified contractors will be able to submit an offer without the Pathways to Success Training, the Readiness Assessment, and certain sections of the Technical proposal.

change.title: Professional Services Schedule Consolidation

motivation.description:
To ease procurement of professional services, all professional service schedules have been consolidated under the new Professional Services Schedule on October 1st. The following GSA schedules have been consolidated into the new Professional Services Schedule on October 1st:

  • MOBIS Schedule 874
  • PES Schedule 871
  • FABS Schedule 520
  • AIMS Schedule 541
  • LOGWORLD Schedule 874 V
  • Environmental Schedule 899
  • Language Schedule 738 II

effect.description:
Since the changes have taken place on October 1st, no action is needed by vendors since the change will be managed via a unilateral MassMod.

You can learn more about the Professional Services Schedule (PSS) on the Professional Service Category Community on Interact or the PSS portal page, Professional Service Schedule.

change.title: Updated Help Links Throughout eOffer/eMod

motivation.description: A new improved help center has been developed to assist users with eOffer/eMod. The links throughout eOffer/eMod have been updated to remove old help content and send users to the new site.

effect.description: View the new eOffer/eMod Help Center.

change.title: Duplicate Manufacturer Part Number Enhancement

motivation.description: As of November 23, 2015, contractors can upload duplicate Manufacturer Part Numbers (MPNs) to GSA Advantage. This enhancement will eliminate the need to manipulate the MPN when a contractor has items from multiple manufacturers that use the same MPN.

effect.description:
Contract holders should take this opportunity to review and update their price lists for both accuracy and completeness. Any altered Manufacturer Part Numbers should be updated so as to be identical to the numbers issued by the manufacturer.

Per clauses I-FSS-600 Contract Price Lists and 552.238-71 (Submission and Distribution of Authorized FSS Schedule Price Lists), price lists must be complete, and include all supplies, prices, and terms and conditions awarded under a contractor’s FSS contract. A complete price list means that all awarded base products are listed along with all associated descriptive data (to include MPN).

Going forward you should ensure that correct manufacturer part numbers are submitted for all products in your price list.

change.title: Auto-split for Bundled Instantly Effective Price Reduction Modifications

motivation.description:
As of May 2015, temporary price reduction modifications and permanent price reduction modifications were enhanced to become effective immediate. This includes the following mods:

  • Temporary Price Reduction
  • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customers)
  • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Requested)

However when these modifications were submitted with other modifications that were not designed to go into effect immediately, Contracting Officers had to manually separate these modifications.

The temporary and permanent price reduction modifications will not be automatically separated by eMod and will go into effect immediately.

effect.description:
You should be aware that the following modifications will automatically receive an effective date that is identical to the date of submission:

  • Temporary Price Reduction
  • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customers)
  • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Requested)

Please note, you will still need to submit your price change via SIP/EDI in order for the change to be reflected on Advantage.

change.title: Technical Proposal Creation in eOffer

motivation.description:
As a part of the eOffer, vendors have to submit a technical proposal, covering topics such as corporate experience, past performance, and quality control. Prior to this update, vendors would have to compile this information in a separate document, and attach it to their offers.

GSA took the opportunity to standardize and streamline the process across the MAS program by creating electronic forms within the eOffer system. This new robust format allows for increased simplicity, while preserving the commodity-specific elements of certain schedules/SINs.

effect.description:
During the course of 2015, each solicitation in eOffer will include a new section, titled “solicitations provisions”. In this section, offerors will address provisions specific to each solicitation, and provide written detail about their corporate experience, past performance, and quality control.

Requirements of each section of the provisions are listed with the corresponding text entry boxes. This ensures consistency and completeness from the vendors. You must respond to all provisions listed in the table, before you may submit your offer.

The result is a more user-friendly system and standardized eOffer that Contracting Officers can process more efficiently.

More information on the Solicitation Provisions process can be found in the eOffer Help Center.

image.caption: Vendors will now enter their technical proposals throught he Solicitation Provisions section of eOffer.
image.alternateText: Vendors will now enter their technical proposals throught he Solicitation Provisions section of eOffer.

change.title: Price Reduction Modifications Now Take Effect Upon Submission

motivation.description: In the past, vendors submitting temporary or permanent price reduction modifications would need to wait for the Contracting Officer to approve the modification before the modification took effect. In order to better suit the needs of industry, the process needed to be streamlined. Therefore, it was decided that price reduction modifications would be effective immediately upon submission.

effect.description:
The following modifications will automatically receive an effective date that is identical to the date of submission:

  • Temporary Price Reduction
  • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customer)
  • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Request)

In submitting these modifications, you are now required to agree to the following statements:

  • This modification is allowed ONLY to reflect price reductions to be applied to the awarded items under my Multiple Award Schedule contract. No other changes can be included, and all other contract terms and conditions remain in full effect.
  • Submitted price reduction modifications are effective immediately upon submission.
  • I must update my Authorized Federal Supply Schedule Price List as soon as possible to reflect the price reductions described herein.

Please note, you will still need to submit your price change via SIP/EDI in order for the change to be reflected on Advantage.

image.caption: Price reduction mods will now go into effect upon submission.
image.alternateText: Price reduction mods will now go into effect upon submission.
